user_review: Pooh and I came here for breakfast after a wild St. Valentines Day celebration, last night. We both started off with double lattés and then we had the Mexican breakfast which included 2 burritos, home fries and we replaced the fruit with sliced tomatoes. Our server was very pleasant and answered all our questions with a smile. We came back here for breakfast this morning. This time I had chicken and waffles and Pooh breakfast Poutine - both delicious!!!

Universel is located on Peel street in the middle of downtown Montreal. Overall this place was good, but Montreal has so many amazing brunch spots that sometimes good doesn't cut it. We went with a group of 10 people. Reserved ahead of time but they didn't have a table ready for us when we got there (even though the restaurant was pretty empty). In addition, they first put us at two different tables instead of combining them into one long one (which was very possible and which we ended up doing). Apart from this, however, the service was good. The servers were very sweet, fast, and efficient for serving such a large table. The menu was very comprehensive and everything sounded delicious. The food was good, but nothing to write home about. The presentation of the eggs benny was also average. The atmosphere was really nice out on the patio.

What a great place for breakfast !Service was above and beyond but the check was a little pricey.Tables are a bit close so we ended up making friends with a few tables next to us and really had a socially good time, talking to people from all over Canada . We just happened to be in town when they were having a marathon so there were many people in town for this. I ordered the sampler breakfast and as you can see it had a little bit of everything on it, even a scoop of meat type deviled ham salad stuff below the orange in the pic I attached.After finishing it all I was content until lunch.This place seemed to be in a great location in Montreal to start the day if you are walking the city like us.If I am ever near here again I would stop back in.

No reservations needed for a group of four on a Saturday morning. Packed restaurant with lots of enticing dishes to choose from as you're waiting to place your order.Again, the menu has all sorts of options, but couldn't say no to the Breakfast Poutine ($12). A layering of home fries, curds, Hollondaise, gravy, bacon, and a sunny-side up egg. Despite everything involved in the dish, the portion size was moderate enough to not make you too full. Fries are crisp and the egg/bacon is always a good combination.Service can take a little bit considering the crowd, but not egregiously slow. Would come back again to try a crepe.

Great place for brunch in the heart of downtown! I ordered the classic eggs benedict and a chocolate milkshake. The eggs benedict was spot on! I would definitely recommend the eggs benedict. The chocolate milkshake was pretty good, not too sweet. Although, the breakfast potatoes were a bit too salty for me. The portion was pretty big, I barely got through it. I loved the outdoor seating! Very cozy and cute! I would like to come back next time and try out their lunch menu!

If I could go back to this place I totally would in a heart beat. The food is so amazing and well cooked that I never even got a chance to take a picture of it. The plates are a great size for the price you pay. I am also very pleased with the atmosphere of the place, very clean, professional and beautifully decorated. The staff was extremely helpful and speak an array of languages in case you are not from the area. Everything on the menu is worth trying and I guarantee it won't be a place you regret.

Breakfast Poutine - Delicious and filling! This is definitely a heavier dish, so be warned. Personally, I feel there was a tad too much of the hollandaise sauce and thought the bites with hot dog pieces were pretty overpoweringly hot dog flavored rather than balanced. Overall a good, hearty breakfast though, complete with home fries, cheese curds, bacon, hot dog pieces, hollandaise sauce for that brunch feel, and an egg cooked in your choice of style!Madagascar Mussels - Good flavor and solid portion size! You can definitely taste the cognac in the sauce! The fries were delicious and went well together.
I love this breakfast spot! Been twice and both times were a success. The place does get packed so there is usually a wait. Food is delicious and there's plenty on the plate. I left full both times.
Great breakfast spot! Prices are cheap and reasonable. Food is delicious, real squeezed orange juice.

This review is long over due!Universel restaurant on Peel street is and will always be a great go to restaurant no matter the occasion.  (4@7, get togethers with friends or fam, QT with someone special etc...) I have been to this restaurant on many occasions at different times of the day, and different days of the week and have yet to be disappointed! They serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner! They serve Mimosas which is a + in my books whenever having brunch...KUDOS to this Restaurant's team and management!Their specials on drinks vary depending on the day of the week... personally, I love their 2/1 on Martinis (2/$13) on Fridays...they know how to make drinks and especially Martinis, in other words, they are not skimpy on the alcohol...Food portions are great to generous....5/5Quality of food is and has always been consistent5/5Service always on point 5/5Dining area and restrooms are always clean 5/5This restaurant is within walking distance from Peel metro station (green line)Street parking is availableTerrasse is available during the Summer season There are other Universel restaurants, but I vouch for this location as I have been going there since 2014.

Pretty good standard breakfast in the heart of downtown. I came here with a friend on Saturday around 11 and we waited about 15 minutes for a table. We were seated on their patio which was nice for people watching and enjoying the last days of nice weather. The menu is huge, classic brunch options. My friend and I shared an omelet as well as a combo plate which came with eggs, toast, French toast and some fruit. Both plates came with potatoes. The food was good and came out hot. The price is fair for the location. Service was pleasant.I wouldn't come here for a special occasion brunch but definitely for a post hangover brunch if that makes sense!

Took me a while to select from the menu. So many options, all very affordable. Service was awesome. The eggs benedict wasn't amazing and the portion was generous. The breakfast dishes were combos which included crepes, waffles, eggs and bacon (sweet and salty).

The eggs benedict with smoked salmon was delicious. Smoked salmon in particular was very fresh even at 2 pm, which says a lot about the restaurant. For some reason we were being lead to a table where there was an accident (liquid everywhere on the floor, mirror behind table was broken!). Staff should be more attentive and clean up EVERYTHING before seating customers. Decor was generic - the interior is modern and the colour palette is lime green and silver (which I find over done). Overall, it's a good place to stop by for some quality food.

This restaurant is so close to the Best Western at Peel and Sherbrooke that we ended up eating here three times during our four night, three day stay. Breakfast combos are plentiful and gave us leftovers to snack on during the day between two adult meals and a kids meal with the baby eating whatever he wanted to try off our plates.Food was good (stuffed ravioli with chorizo and cream sauce was amazing), service was particularly excellent during the one dinner time (July 22), and 2/3 times, we used the adjacent office building lobby for our baby to run around. At our one breakfast, one family stored a large stroller behind our table with ample room to get around it, and at the other breakfast, the gentleman seating us expertly solved our booth/table desire dilemma (so we could secure our own booster seat to the chair but let our older son be comfortable), with a half booth/table, so this is a GREAT place for families. The only thing is that I didn't use the bathrooms so I can't vouch for a change table.

Really great atmosphere, even though the place was bustling with people we got seated very quickly since it is a spacious place. Ordered Eggs Benedict and it was my first time trying them. Enjoyed them quite a bit, soft and creamy which complimented the crispiness and dryness of the potatoes on the side. They gave a little bowl of fruit with my plate but unfortunately some of the fruit went to waste because I don't not like cantaloupe or melon. The service was good and polite, the only thing is that they forgot about our toast and we had to remind them for it 5 minutes after our food came. I would say it's a standard price point for brunch around $14+ for each plate,I wouldn't mind coming here again!

We came here for a family birthday brunch as a large group on a Saturday.  One of the reasons I chose the place was that it takes reservations for big groups.  We had young children and elderly people so I didn't want people to have to wait in line.  Reservations are really recommended especially for weekends, as there was a lineup out the door when we got there.  Even having reserved, our table wasn't ready when we got there.  The hostess seemed stressed and snapped at us that she wouldn't seat our group until everyone was there (we had 10 out of 12 people there already).  It wasn't the best start to the meal, but 5 minutes later she relented and let us have the table.  Things improved after that, our server was very nice and even though the place was packed, service was friendly and fairly prompt under the circumstances.  The menu is extensive with all the usual brunch standards and prices were reasonable.  I had a smoothie and the healthy omelette.  The food was ok, everyone liked their meal. Decor was modern and attractive, restaurant was clean.  Only three stalls in the women's bathroom, resulting in a rather long wait.  A place this busy and this big could use a larger restroom.  Overall decent brunch place and a good place to go if you're a big group, just be sure to reserve ahead on a weekend.

Came here for brunch and LOVED it. We sat outside in the sun and ordered two eggs, crepes and French Toast, with Café au lait and Mimosas. The food was ample and delicious. Service was prompt and friendly. Perfect experience. We will go back tomorrow!

This is more 3.5 stars but rounding up due to friendly service. We went to this restaurant solely for convenience, being next to the Residence Inn where we stayed. They were very nice to our family including young children, which we appreciated. We had the fois gras torchon (room temperature, a spread format - I still prefer the hot preparations but just my taste), Montreal mussels and fries (tomato flavor), and kids' pizza. The food wasn't that memorable, but the staff provided very nice service and answered all our allergy questions thoroughly.

I came here on two separate occasions. Salmon benedict and the fruit platter are excellent options. I didn't care much for the bread used for the benedict but since there was so much food, I ended up eating mainly just the salmon and egg. Potatoes and fruits came with the benedict-- the fruit was fresh and the potatoes were delicious.The fruit platter was good too. Large plate with a great variety of fruits. They were sweeter and smaller than what I'm used to, so probably organic. Plus, the strawberries were all a deep red; not overly large and white (You'll only know wth I'm talking about if you're from the states and eat the non-organic crap)The side of bacon was weak; flimsy thin cut slices. Definitely could do without that.... sucks because I love bacon!-Berry smoothie and the mimosas were both pretty tasty too-Cappuccino was no good-Had the same waitress both days; she was terrific-Restaurant gets packed for breakfast; there may be a little wait-Nice setup to the layout of the restaurant; they pay attention to a lot of little details
Ate here when in town for a few days. We actually ate breakfast here every morning. Great food and service. Fresh food for sure. Menu is in English or French depending on the side.
Great food. I came here 2 days during my Montréal trip.Honestly, the service is a little slow. They could hire more staff
Their location on Peel is very charming and spacious, so the wait isn't usually over 30mins. The service is great and food is ok, will definitely come back because lt's convenient.

We went for brunch for a friends birthday. Wait time can be long, but they take reservations, so take advantage of that.Food is decent, drinks are fine. The waitress did give us a free round of shots which was pretty cool considering how long it took to order drinks/food. This is essentially an IHOP that has a liquor license.

Food wise: 5 starts Service wise: 0 starsCanadian service is unlike American; takes a long time to get the waiters attention if you want to add something to your order or ask for something. The food was truly delicious, we order the mushroom Benedict and the lox bagel. The Benedict came with fresh delicious fruit and the lox bagel came in a beautiful presentation but the bagel was a bit cold. This place was a little pricey but when you walk in you can definitely feel the high class vibes.

great place for breakfast, good quality dishes and very friendly service. got the healthy omelette, side of toast was more like side of bread (not toasted at all)  but that's my only complaint. fruit selection was great. and coffee is complimentary with most dishes, they also offer coffee to go cups and will refill prior to you leaving. would return

We tried this place but overall so disappointing. Food is ok nothing great or wow. The outside terrace has such poor service. Our food arrived before our drinks and they pretended it was coming instead of saying we forgot. Waiters can make the difference. Here certain of them make the effort and some others really don't care. Inside the restaurant service seemed better looking through the glass

Perfect place for brunch. We ordered Florentine egg Benedict and Strawberry & custard crepe. The portion is huge and the food was delicious, well worth the price, combining with exceptional service. The crepe has the perfect sweetness, not overly sweetened like I had at other places.

A fine option for breakfast or lunch downtown. Huge menu of sandwiches, breakfasty goods like eggs/benedicts, waffles, crepes, etc. Plus tasty liquid refreshment like juices/smoothies, coffees, etc.I came on a Saturday afternoon and didn't have a wait at all, even though it was definitely pretty busy. Got a tasty juice of strawberries, mango, banana, yogurt, honey, and cranberries. So good! For my meal I went with the strawberry breakfast combo which was 2 eggs, potatoes, crepes with strawberries, and toast. Huge portions and a ton of variety for just $12. Those combos are totally the way to go if you want something sweet AND savory.  And everything was perfectly cooked and tasty. Service was quick and nice enough. The space is bright and light. It does get a bit loud when busy, so just an FYI. A woman in the party next to me was clearly very hungover and didn't seem too thrilled by the volume. Ha!
The place is nice but the food is not great in my opinion. Would not come back here.

I really love Universel! When I went to McGill, I would go at least once a month either for breakfast, brunch, or lunch.The menu is HUGE! and every option that I have tried out has been delicious. The prices are fair and the service is pretty quick.If you are a larger group, think about making a reservation- otherwise you should be fine. Do no drive there: parking on Peel is a nightmare (just take the metro, it's literally right next door!)

I came here on a weekday for brunch with mt friend.  We were sat quickly.  I ordered the Eggs Benedict with Smoked Salmon.  The meal was very filling.  It came with potatoes and fruits.  My friend ordered a crepe filled with bananas, strawberries, and chocolate.  It was very decadent.  I also ordered this drink that had cranberry, mango, banana, yogurt and honey.  It was very light and not too sweet.We were sat outside per request and it was nice weather!  Perfect place for brunch outside.

This is one of those places FOOD COMA will hit you. The waiters and waitresses were very flexible with speaking English and French. The atmosphere was quite nice and clean. Opinion of indoor seating or outdoor.  Great way to start the day with breakfast or brunch. I had their Classic Eggs benedict (2 poached eggs, ham, cheese on an English muffin) with the L'univers (Strawberries, banana, blueberries, melon, kiwi, honey and orange). The egg benedict seem very simple and not a large portion but it was actually very fulling. I love when restaurants serve fruits as a side with the meal, as full as you are some fruits won't hurt. The food came really quickly and the service was pretty good. Great for breakfast & brunch and the prices are affordable.

This was the first restaurant we tried after arriving late into Montreal late one evening.  The concierge at Omni Hotel provided us with some options and Universel was the first one and virtually right next door to the hotel.  Universel was so good that we went back twice during the week in Montreal.  The place has a combination of outdoor seating under a covered area and the indoor dining room.  Tables consist of smaller two seaters to comfy booth seating.  They have a good selection of many different food selections from sandwiches to seafood and the traditional steak frites.  I would recommend the moule with frites which is the mussels served in your choice of 4 different sauces and fries.  The serving is a huge heaping bowlful of juicy mussels and a basket of fries.  My only wish was that the fries are the thinner variety vs the freshcut which they serve. Desserts are decadent here and ordered the chocolate mousse cake and a side of vanilla ice cream.  The pricing is reasonable and even better converted to USD from CAD. Service is top notch here with friendly and careful attention by its servers.  We had the privilege of having Francis the first visit which was topped by Anabelle on our last visit.  She is the BEST!!
The breakfast i order everywhere, eggs and sausage, was ok. We took a table on the terrace, it was fun. Staff friendly and nice. Nice experience but it laced the "i definitely come again" element.

Walked into this beautiful establishment on our last day, we were sat in the patio after requesting to sit there. The waitress was very sweet and welcoming, giving us more than enough time to decide what we wanted for breakfast. My hubby ordered their Universel breakfast which consists one bagel toasted and halved, then topped with every single possible breakfast item you can think of. I ordered the Florentine Eggs Benedict :) we also got smoked salmon on the side. It was sooooooo filling, we both waddled out of there. Also, they offer extra condiments on the side, ketchup, mayo and Tabasco sauce were brought to the table upon us ordering. They checked on us quite often too, refilling our water whenever it was needed without us asking. Would definitely come back.

My friends and I stopped by here the morning of our (8-hour) departure because it was close to Parc du Mont-Royal, which we hadn't visited yet. It wasn't too busy on the Sunday morning we had went (it was actually quite empty, which unnerved me initially), but that wasn't indicative of the quality of the food experience to follow! Two of us ordered omelettes, and the other ordered strawberry, banana, and hazelnut chocolate French toast. And don't be alarmed by the fruit juice prices; the glass is tall and easily serves two. Everything was wonderfully delicious, and the servings were generous, providing us just the energy we needed to hike up to the look-out spot. The service was okay; we had to really wave down our server when we needed to leave because we were on a tight schedule. Overall, I'd recommend it!

Wow! What an amazing weekend brunch my girlfriend and I had at Universel! Despite being quite crowded, our service was excellent and we got a great table on the covered/heated patio (this was in April!). I ordered the full breakfast complete with crepe, eggs, toast, fresh fruit, bacon, and potatoes. My girlfriend also enjoyed her eggs benedict. We will have to come back to try all the different varieties they offer. Fun note to Americans: many of the dishes come with "creton" ... try it! It's a pork and onion spread that tastes much better than it looks! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone staying in Montreal!

Solid four stars. Quick and friendly service.  Great breakfast variety, and large portion.  I really like the display of fresh fruit that came with each dish.  The coffee was so fresh and hot.  No rush attitude.  I had the specialty universal omelette with large amounts of meats.  Very good.  Maybe next time I can get s table outside!!!

Good food with lots of options. Great service, Emily took really good care of us. Thank you! It was a wonderful evening :) I went back for supper and I can confirm, this place should come up to your mind when ever you want to have a great meal alone or with friends, date, etc... When you go for the first time and you're satisfied it might be luck but when you go more than twice it's an evidence. Go! You won't regret it!

I came here twice on my Montréal trip. The food is delicious and seasoned just right. Perhaps a tad too much salt on my home fries. The decor is big, bright, and happy, just what breakfast restaurants should be like! Their portions are huge. Seating is a bit squishy but totally doable. I got the 2 eggs, 3 bacon, 3 sausages thing which came with coffee/tea, fruits, and toast. All that for $11.95+tax! It was a sweet deal. Free refills for coffee and tea too. I'd definitely recommend coming here if you're in downtown Montréal. They are ridiculously busy in the morning throughout the week, but you can usually find a seat in 5 min.1 star deduction was for in I'm personable service by our server the second time we went. I think it's because his English wasn't that great.

Had the most amazing experience at Universel. It was a very busy Sunday morning and the restaurant seemed pretty full but we were seated right away. Waiters seemed to speak French and English fluently. We ordered a combo meal, two eggs meal, and universel breakfasts. We also started with lattes which were prepared well and delicious.My universel breakfast was HUGE; the portions are pretty crazy. The meal came with the crepe, the potatoes, two eggs, toast, choice of meat, baked beans, and fruit. This came out to be $18 Canadian dollars which is like $14 USD. Amazing deal especially for the cost.  For the crepe I added strawberries, bananas, and Nutella. The breakfast potatoes were seasoned very well. I don't typically like breakfast potatoes but I actually loved these. Service was great and we were attended to frequently. Great service, food, and experience!

Delicious!Woke this afternoon, my wife was having trouble finding which restaurant to go, so I YELPed it!The breakfast/brunch is amazing and it arrived quite fast after we ordered it. Great I dying of hunger lol.I was really pleased with the food, although I ordered the standard, easy, traditional, most simple breakfast; eggs, bacon, ham & sausage. And my love ordered the original benedict.Service is okay, on their defence... They are really crowded and the place is all packed! With that kind of food, it makes perfect sense! :)Price is not bad at all, roughly average $11-$13 per person with coffee and stuff.Will go back for sure!

Severely regret choosing this restaurant as our send off as we are from out of town and headed on home. Our server was Angie. The service was quite bad and the wait staff could not be less remorseful about that. My sisters and moms coffee came easily 20 minutes after they ordered them. Food was timely but the wait staff was often no where to be found when we needed to ask for something or they would walk past us and blatantly ignore our calls "excuse me". When we finally asked for our bill, our server disappeared off and we had to ask a different man who worked there to bring it to us. When he did, we held our cool, paid, tipped. In the end, I simply and extremely respectfully informed him that we were appreciate of our server working hard to manage a busy restaurant but perhaps they could use an extra person so everyone wouldn't have to wait that long to be helped. He passive aggressively responded with "good idea" and ran away. He was clearly not happy with the feedback. Very immature.

Don't come here if you have celiac disease. The waitress thought gluten was lactose. They know absolutely nothing about gluten. You will feel very uncomfortable eating in this place and you WILL get sick. They will bring you gluten even if they tell you there isn't.Avoid this place if you have allergies or celiac disease

Sorry Yelpers, but you didn't find us a good place this time.  We came here for breakfast, and fortunately it wasn't busy and our group was seated promptly.For drinks, most of us ordered tea as it was cold outside.  Of the 5 of us, only 1 had hot water. The rest of us had luke warm to cold, making it impossible for tea.  When I asked for a refill of the hot water, it was still lukewarm.  Apparently tea is not a popular drink, or they would know that it's hot water we need (kettle anyone?).Our server was abrupt with us, and perhaps she already had a bad morning.  The food was a bit pricey for breakfast, and I guess I must have ordered the wrong thing... ham and eggs with potatoes were just ok.  Giving this 3 "A OK" stars. It wasn't terrible but it wasn't "OMG good".  With so many other places in Montreal, this place can do better.
Awesome food with reasonable price, very spacious place & very efficient service. The universel breakfast with latte is very impressive.

I ordered the big breakfast combo (I've forgotten the name) with over easy eggs, bacon, toast, baked beans, hash browns, and a goddamn crepe to top it off. Of course I added strawberries and bananas to the crepe. Everything was delicious. Coffee refills were quick. Service was great. An excellent breakfast!

Honestly the place is above 4 stars IMO, I don't know of many breakfast places in all of Canada that handle this kind of volume and maintain a reasonably high level of food qualityGreat breakfast items, huge fresh fruit selection, fantastic smoothies to go with your loaded breakfast.  Skip the coffee because Castel is across the street.

Alright! I came here for a Friday brunch around 11:45 in a party of 14. We made a reservation ahead of time, and were able to accomodate our group no problem. I ordered the breakfast poutine, which consisted of a hollandaise sauce on a plate of breakfast potatoes, with sausage bits. The quality of the food was decent--on par with other brunch establishments--but not amazing. The portion was good and very filling. The food was deserving of a 3.5, but the service was what really took it up a notch. The waiters, despite the restaurant being packed, were attentive and fast. The kitchen was pushing out food at an incredible rate. I was pleasantly surprised that the coffee I ordered was included with the meal; I am so used to paying for brewed coffee that it was a nice way to finish my meal. I would recommend Universel, but it can be packed depending on when you go. If you have a large party, make a reservation before hand!

OVERALL: Decently priced American brunch food. INTERIORS: Pretty and very modernly decorated. SERVICE: The waitress who waited on us was okay... it wasn't exceptional service and I am not sure if it's because of the day I visited (New Year's Day) or because it was just crazy busy. FOOD: Similarly, I wasn't blown away by the quality. I ordered a Western sandwich and it was okay... I could've made it at home. What they do not have in quality they definitely make up in the quantity which, if that is a good thing for you then you might find it good here. For my croissant sandwich they gave me potato "fries" + a few slices of fruit. My bf ordered the bacon eggs benedict and it was also decent. Too much hollondaise sauce though...but he also got potato "fries" + a bowl of fruit. I would say though that even though both those dishes weren't remarkable, their crepes were definitely good. We ordered the banana hazelnut chocolate one and it was GOOD. They did not skimp on the banana's or the hazelnut chocolate sauce. It was the best part of the meal, even my bf agreed. OVERALL: If you want some good crepes, definitely recommend. Otherwise, in terms of diner food it was okay... not the most mind blowing meal I've had in Montreal. But if you're in a pinch, this place is not bad :)

Great place for breakfast! We were promptly seated. Our server was cordial and expedient. I was surprised at how fast our meal came as we showed up at noon, got one of the last tables and were eating within 15 min of sitting down. I had the omelette with Swiss cheese and ham, potatoes, bread, fruit and tea. Everything was prepared well. Their home style potatoes were excellent. For $13.00 including coffee or tea it's a steal.Would happily go back and try other items on their large menu.

We dropped in here for a quick lunch before a tour at McGill. It was pretty packed but we got in quickly. Service was quick, food was decent. I had the pesto mussels and fries. Nothing to write home about but definitely a good spot.

We were visiting from Toronto and came here for breakfast. We ordered toast and French toast. The French toast tasted and looked fine but the toast had mold on it. When we told the server, she seemed surprised and said she would get us new toast. As for the French toast, she said "that bread wasn't from the same batch". But how would we know that?? She should have changed everything for us. As an apology, we each got a mini size juice. But we feel the meal should have been free. I mean.. it is MOLD after all...

Amazing place for breakfast and lunch.We've been seated on the covered heated terrace - great winter solution. I've ordered Egg Benedict with salmon and my wife took omelette with Bree. Egg Benedict came on a fat bagel with half plate of potatoes and a separate bowl of fruits. Omelette was accompanied by 4 toasts and a slice of pineapple. Daughter was the only one who got exactly what she ordered - crepes with bananas and hazelnut chocolate. So next time there we'd probably order one dish for two.Everything we ordered was pretty good. Latte wasn't superior, but good enough to be taken without sugar.Good location - right on our way to Mount Royal.

I've come here twice. The first time I had quite the unpleasant experience. There was a sign at the door saying they cannot seat you until everyone has arrived. Granted it was very busy that day, so I respected this and sat at the door. Then I realized none of the servers would even look at me, which I found very rude. Had I not already told my friends to meet me here, I would've left immediately. Needless to say this restaurant gave me a terrible first impression. I also found the service after we were seated to be slow and disorganized. The second time I was here because another friend really likes this place. The food is quite good. The space is big so it's good for large groups because there isn't much of a wait time. It's a good place to eat brunch if you don't want to go far (from downtown core) or if you have no other ideas.

LOCATION: We stayed in a Montreal for a week and this joint was conveniently located at the heart of downtown--and I WILL NOT COME BACK HERE.BUILDING: As soon as we went inside, we were impressed by the interior of the restaurant. We were seated by the window at the indoor patio and our floor was flooded. The rain water dripping to our food and drinks was huge problem. I hope that when the management read this review they'll take time to fix there ceilings.FOOD: The prices on the menu raised the level of my expectations. But I was quite disappointed of the way they cooked and handled our food. I've ordered Salmon and it was straight down oily. My girlfriend ordered a medium-well steak and 1/3 of the meat were undercooked and nearly raw.SERVICE: We weren't impressed by the service either. Our server told us the we were getting a basket of bread and later forgot. And what didn't make sense was that she removed the basket of jams/jellies on our table after she told us that we were getting bread. We had to ask her for the bread, and the jellies.
A pretty good place for hangover brunch. I'm sorry I can't be more helpful but, well, I was very hungover.It does tea and pancakes and that was good at the time.
This is out all time favorite breakfast in Montreal. Been here many times, love their service and Food quality.
We came here everyday with our baby during our stay here in Montreal! Excellent service!

Universal has the best breakfast that my girlfriend and I both agree we've ever had in our lives.  We've been here several times on trips to Montreal and each time it never fails to impress.  First, I highly recommend their juice smoothies.  Fresh fruits are blended together for the most delicious mix possible.  The Eggs Benedict were perfect, the potatoes were browned perfectly with crispy texture and the crepes were spot on.  Reasonable price, good service, good portions, and outstanding food!

We ate here for first time last year, and it was simply amazing! So naturally, we had to go back again during this visit. If I had to rate this restaurant last year, I would have given it a 5, but unfortunately our experience just didn't live up to our expectations. Now, don't get me wrong. This is still a wonderful restaurant and I would totally recommend it to others. In retrospect, we were only 5 people during the first visit, and this time our party was 8, so that may have resulted in a slightly lower standard :(I would still go back hoping that it may change my mind and push the rating up to 5 stars :)Server/ Host knowledge: 4.5Server/host attitude: 4.5Fast service: 4Food Menu: 5Drinks Menu: 4Food quality: 4Food Portion: 5Ambience: 4.5Distance to other tables: 4Cleanliness: 4.5Comfort: 4.5Waiting time to get seated: 4Price: 4
Very good breakfast! I love the mushroom Benedict ..our server was so helpful and kind .. he gave us great trip ideas in Montreal ! We went twice during our short trip
Strongly recommend smoked salmon eggs benedict. I wanted to try a local Montreal dish and this was delicious. I was so full by the end of the meal. Great service too.

Service was slow/non existent. The mimosa I ordered came out with the food, had to ask the busser for coffee, food came out cold, grabbed our own sauces from server station. We spoke to the manager and he gave us a free smoothie? The food was good and portions are generous, but I would not visit again.

Pretty decent brunch place near where we were staying. The portions are HUGE for the price and the decor of the restaurant is very welcoming. We ordered two dishes of the Salmon Lox, one dish of the blueberry crepes, a banana/nutella crepe, eggs, strawberry mimosas, coffee and orange juice. Everything was very delicious however I noticed that they didn't give us a bread basket compared to the other tables. The service could have been better though so I would have to deduct a star for those two negatives. Probably wouldn't come here again but it was a good brunch place nonetheless!

This restaurant reminded me of an upscale NY/NJ diner. They have a large menu with a variety of options. And the service was quick! I only had breakfast here and both were great. My second breakfast was of Eggs Benedict with Mushrooms- great!!

It's with a heavy heart that I write this review as I was the one who suggested that my friends and I come here for brunch. Unfortunately, I was the only one who left this restaurant extremely unsatisfied. The service is incompetent. There's one good server and everyone else is no good. One of the servers spilled my water all over our table, on me, and then all over my seat. I could sense that he was inexperienced and I also overheard him saying under his breath: "well, this is off to a great start." As much as I love sarcasm, I don't appreciate it much in these sorts of situations. He earnestly cleans the table and makes sure that the table isn't wet but forgets to wipe my chair which is wet and to bring me new utensils and a water glass as all those items got soaked. I then have to ask for a new glass of water and some extra napkins to clean up and make myself comfortable again. Fun.Okay, now the food. Two of my friends order the same dish as me. Our dish comes with a side of fruit. I noticed that my fruit bowl looks sparse in comparison to theirs. I realize I'm missing some apples, and normally I wouldn't mind but they already spilled water on me so I figure why not? I ask another server for some apple and he looks at me like I'm an asshole. He never comes back with the apple! Finally, I ask our main waitress and she does retrieve them - wow, was that so difficult? I dig into my food and it's barely warm. It was tasty but I'm pretty sure this dish was not supposed to be room temperature...unless Canadians just eat their Eggs Benedict that way. And so much for Eggs Benedict with poached eggs as my egg yolks were not runny.
We had Universel breakfast and eggs Benedict. I's recommend that you get eggs Benedict, very yummy! Universel breakfast was ok and the serving was HUGE, but taste was 7/10. Service was superb. :)

The food was decent but daaammmn was my waiter rude. The service was super average and  she clearly forgot about us for most of the time (didn't even bother refilling water).What really made me hate this place was when it came to pay she took one glance at the bill, and said in a super snobby way that I didn't tip enough, and looked at me with such entitlement it made me laugh. I told her the way she said it was rude and she proceeded to stand there and stare at me to increase my tip. Management please do something about her, shes ruining your business and while the food was good, I definitely won't be coming back and have only negative things to say about this whole dinner.

Fabulous brunch spot with lots of options. My little brother's favorite place to eat in the city. The crepes and breakfast poutine are delicious. Loved sitting out in the terrace during the summer time too!

I woke up after a heavy night of drinking and decided I needed some breakfast I stumbled many streets until I found this place called the universal the outside is nothing to look at as there's a glass enclosure that has tables that I assumed eventually get taken however I stumbled my way inside to meet the Ukrainian waitress. She was very pleasant as was Miguel ( I assume that was his name) who was bussing tables I ordered a Coca-Cola as I was all out of sorts in the morning and I loaded up on a delicious breakfast it came soon after like I did the night before hiyyyooo.The breakfast was delicious the French toast amazing the bacon crispy all in all it was a fantastic visit minus the sleazy French accent in the background but that's none of my business

I am sorry but yes I experienced much-much better and I am not talking about fancy places like L'avenue but standard good places like beauty for example. The place looks fancy and charges like its a fancy place( between $$ and $$$) but  I have no idea why they stopped there and didnt bring the food to a fancy level as well. I ordered one of the omelets and like previous reviews my meal was very dry. Both the omelet and potatoes were over cooked (extremely dry) my friends at the table also complained their stuff was too dry. They forgot to bring us stuff (like coffee, butter etc) and worst of all we kept hearing shutting from the kitchen. Overall not an amazing experience food -wise and atmosphere wise.

Loved everything about the place. The food was delicious. And nice modern fancy decor. I had a breakfast pizza. So different and tasty, sweet and salty with a hint of cinnamon. I ate it all! My boyfriend got the breakfast poutine which was also amazing although really heavy. The chai latte was also delicious. The only Negative point was that it was very loud and over crowded.

This place probably deserves 3.5 stars, but rounding it off to 4 because of the server who was amazing. I stayed at the residence inn next door and came here for a late lunch on a weekday. As another yelped said in their review, this place is very dinerish in the US sense, with huge menus from eggs, crepes, pizza, pasta, burgers etc. They serve breakfast till 3pm everyday, which is great for someone like me who loves eggs. I had the vegetable omelette (carrots, spinach, mushroom, onions, peppers) with goat cheese..it was very hearty and filling. The toast was half decent, but not a big fan of the home fries...they were pretty tasteless. If I ever need a quick decent breakfast, I'll be back.

I've been here tons of times because the location works out well for my friends. Don't go without a reservation.Food: average brunch food I think. Eggs Benedict is the most common order and for good reason - it's done fairly well.Service: slow, mostly because it's always packed at brunch. There are always hoards of people waiting near the entrance which makes it cramped and painful to wait for a table. Even with a reservation, they won't seat your party of 9/10 until your 10th arrives which is annoying.Price: average brunch price. Not much to say here.Ambiance: loud and lively you could say. Not great for a detailed one on one conversation but acceptable for a get together with friends.
Excellent food, fast service, but not super friendly nor accurate. Would go again. Large portions for a relatively good value.

The food was good, there were a ton of options.  I went there because the menu literally has everything you ever want, breakfast or lunch.  Almost too many options! The only complaint I have is the ambiance, it's way too crowded and kinda crazy.  This is not really the place for a relaxing quiet brunch.  But food is good!

Food is great in terms of portions. Also pretty delicious in terms of taste. We were quickly seated because there's a lot of seating at this location... I was actually surprised since it looked like a decent wait but it was pretty immediate. Service was a bit slow but probably because there were quite a few tables occupied.If you're looking for a hearty meal, you can definitely rely on the multiple locations of this restaurant through Montreal!

The best service we got in Montreal. Beautiful my decorated and perfect for brunch with a large menu. Great prices for good sized portions. I loved the universel fresh juice. The oatmeal was great and I enjoyed my fruit bowl. The home fries and western omelette were also perfect. Wonderful for families, groups or dates!

Me and my friends ordered pizzas and there was too much basil on top and they weren't very good. At the end of our lunch we paid but we didn't want to give the tip to the waitress for some our reasons and they obliged us to do that. I think that is a really rude thing...asking money. The only important thing was that we paid the lunch. At the end we paid the tip with EUR because we didn't have any Canadian dollars or dollars in cash. I won't come back again.

For the big hype around it, I wasn't very impressed with the food. We had the Mexican burrito, the salmon omelet, the chocolate and banana crepe and a single pancake with their chocolate hazelnut. Although every ingredient tasted good on its own, the overall flavor was very bland. A very good testament to that is their homemade breakfast potatoes. It is simple, soft and lightly seasoned. The salmon was very sharp and poignant and kinda cancels out all the flavors in the omelet. The crepe was okay with the wrong choice of chocolate. It was soft on the inside and a little crispy on the edges if you love your crepes that way. The only thing I would stay clear of is the pancakes. It was a bit tasteless.  The turnoff of the place is their chocolate. Their hazelnut chocolate is very out of proportion. Not enough milk but lot f hazelnut with what I assume is a very high percentage of dark chocolate. It is an okay place If you are living around the area and don't want to go to Griffintown but there is definitely better places in Montreal to have breakfast.

This place was straight fire. The food was so good. The freshly squeezed orange juice was superb. I would recommend anyone visiting to go to this place for brunch. The Déjeuner Universel was very filling and tasted amazing. The crepes my god they were so good. Come here! Come here now!

Always a good experience at Universel! With an extensive menu of all the brunch classics, there is something for everyone. In fact, there are so many tempting options that the hardest part of ordering is making the final decision. I ordered an omelet with smoked salmon, goat cheese, and red onions which came with potatoes, fruit, and toast which cost $16.50. The price was very reasonable for the amount of food. I was so full I didn't even have to eat for the rest of the day (but obvi I still ate more because eating is the spice of life). They have a full lunch menu as well. Universel is complete with warmhearted servers, lots of seating (even outdoor seating in the warm weather) and fun decor. My one complaint is that drinks such as orange juice or mimosas cost a lot, but are in very small portions.

A very nice brunch place that serves well into the afternoon. There is a large menu with many choices. I got the healthy omelette and thought it was great. Most dishes also come with a big fruit cup which was very nice. The atmosphere is modern and busy. It can  get very crowded so you should make a reservation.

My boyfriend and I came on a Friday around noon. It was busy but were able to sit with no wait. He ordered a mushroom benedict that he really enjoyed and I liked my grilled Cajun salmon wrap even though it wasn't very Cajun. The service was awesome.

Shared a chicken club sandwich with my daughter. It was good and the quantity of food was definitely sufficient. My daughter absolutely loved the onion rings and the staff was very nice to her. I got to watch a bit of World Cup soccer on the TV screens while eating and sipping on coffee. Happy with the visit.

Well, simply amazing! The service was personal, and our server Jimmy was funny, informative and attentive. The food was served fast, hot, fresh and cooked to perfection. Everything was just perfect! The decor was unique with glass globe style lighting on the ceiling. The wallpaper was of a 3 dimensional fabric, very cool design and earthy green color. The atmosphere was fun, friendly and vibrant. Overall, a favorite breakfast place of mine to visit when in Montreal.Highly recommend!

We really enjoyed our brunch here! My only regret is that we found this place on our last day in Montreal! We were looking for a chill place to have brunch and this fit the bill. The menu is expansive and there was so much we wanted to sample. We ordered the florentine eggs benedict, the salmon omlette, a 1/2 order of the nutella and banana waffle and a nutella, banana, and strawberry crepe. It was all a generous portion and delicious.  I loved that they are open early and close late each day. We got there on a Sunday at 10am expecting to have a wait, but we found parking easily, we were sat immediately and served quickly. We sat in the enclosed patio and while there were a lot of people there, it felt comfortable. Our server was outstanding too. I highly recommend and we will definitely be back!!!

This place stood out, oddly enough, by their great fruit bowl. Normally the fruit is the worst or more boring part of a dish but they had generous slices of fresh cantaloupe, honeydew and oranges ... I got the asparagus Benedict with bacon and it was very good- the potatoes were perfectly crispy.
Great place for breakfast. Huge menu, good food and decent prices. Sat at the bar. The staff is terrific.

Universal is an excellent brunch restaurant! My sister and I stopped in around 10AM on a Sunday before heading into Parc Mont-Royal- we definitely needed some food in our bodies before any type of hiking! Although I had seen some reviews saying that service was slow, I thought that our waitress was pretty quick and we didn't have any trouble getting her attention. We ordered one big and one small orange juice, and a small coffee was complimentary with my sister's combo meal. Food portions were quite large. We ordered:1. Eggs Benedict with Smoked Salmon: perfect! And came with the fruit bowl. 2. Sister's combo: I forget which one she had but she got a combo with waffles, Nutella (or some other chocolate hazelnut spread), bananas and strawberries. You should've seen her face of bliss! Even though we had nothing in our stomachs, she still couldn't finish it!Overall, very good brunch. 4/5.

Came here for breakfast twice; first time was to have a good sized breakfast to load up on carbs to burn off while we hiked Mount Royal. I enjoyed their eggs benedict and my friend ordered their eggs benedict florentine. The space is pretty large with a lot of indoor and outdoor seating; when there is a line to be seated and the place is packed, well that's a sign the food must be good. The service was a little slow due to not enough servers. I enjoyed my eggs benedict I just wish it was hot and not just warm, it was fine I ate the whole thing. I also enjoyed their iced mochachino. On my second morning stop in the line and wait time was even longer than the day before. No one gave up on waiting and neither did we. We had a plan of what we wanted to order and we had a plan on stuffing our faces with two huge breakfasts we could share. This time we ordered waffles with bananas and strawberries; an order of eggs benedict florentine and a side of bacon (see photos). I'm glad we came back and waited, their waffles are out of this world amazing. We added their maple syrup which is delicious and it was just the perfect topping. The only thing this place is missing is more staff.

Was here during the bachelor party, woke up earlier than the rest of the crew, decided to take a stroll and grabbed some breakfast near by.  While arrived, we thought, what a nice place to eat on that beautiful day.  When the food came out, it was was only mediocre.  Tasted like your basic Benedict, nothing special.  Although not a bad place to grab breakfast, but certainly not the worth it to go out the way for.

Went on a quiet Monday morning, service was a bit slow because there were only 2 or three servers on the floor when we were there (and the restaurant is very large!). Menu was diverse, with plenty of classic breakfast options, really liked having the option of choosing healthy foods (even though I didn't).Portion sizes were decent for eggs, definitely enough for a brunch, but the French toast was humongous: enough for two people, for sure. Maybe that explains the $14 price tag. Cappuccino was enjoyable.As a college student, this isn't somewhere I would go often as it is expensive for breakfast, nothing I can't make myself at home. Good ambience and more geared for an older crowd.
Service was great. Kind and friendly. Food was decent. Just kinda the basics. Very noisy inside but good for the price.

Montreal is full of great places to eat, but it's downtown core is not an area of town that benefits from regal restaurants. Universal Breakfast will hit the spot for any tourists wondering downtown. Certainly it does the job, but there's nothing here worthy of an Instagram post.
Basic breakfast for a decent price you can't go wrong. The food is fresh and service is fast!

This is one of my favorite places to eat in downtown Montreal! The food is delicious and the staff is extremely friendly. For me, the portions are a little bit big, but the prices are affordable and worth the cost.I would definitely recommend stopping by!

It's ok. I'm giving it three stars because the hostess and waitress were semi rude. The busser was extremely nice and he was very helpful in getting the waitress to actually take my order. The food was ok, the best thing about it was it was really fast so you're day can begin without much delay here. I had a strawberry mimosa, Three cheese omelet and  a side of sausage.

Clean, bright friendly service and open air on a nice day. This pale was about $12 USD-- a steal. My first time to try creton and it was good. Huge plate, large variety and quality taste. Coffee was not the best but a small it own compared to envy thing else. Definitely worth finding

Sorry Yelpers, you guys disappointed me in this. I literally had the worst meal in Montreal or ever. My boyfriend and I came here for a quick lunch since we were staying at the Residence Inn (two buildings over). We ordered Lentil soup,  Escargot Au Gratin, and Roast Beef Sandwich.The Lentil Soup was luke warm and looks like Minestrone soup without the pasta and flavor. It was extremely bland.The Escargot Au Gratin was not the best, but also not the worst. I definitely had better. It looks like they just put the cheese on top of the Escargot and microwave it.The Roast Beef Sandwich was not what I expected. I guess I was expecting more of a deli style roast beef, but that did not happen. The beef was in chunks and over cooked. It comes with brie cheese with tomatoes and lettuce. I ate less than half of the sandwich. I was so sad. I just left the toilet with massive diarrhea. I can't believe I flushed the toliet three times.

Delicious breakfast! I was by myself and got a nice table. Waitress was helpful and nice. She came to check on my several times. I had the strawberry and hazelnut spread crepes. Delicious!!! And so much food!! The strawberry mimosa was good too. Service was fast and food was hot when it arrived. Definitely would go again!
Great place for brunch right by the Omni Montreal if you are visiting. Retro vibe, diner feels, and great prices! Would definitely revisit if I'm back in Canada!

This is a very nice place. Staff is absolutely amazing, attentive and genuinely nice. Most of the food is good, but the crepes.  The crepes are like rubber texture, thick, cold and tasteless. I wish they made them better. Their coffee is really good.

user_city: Carlingwood - McKellar Park - Laurentien View, Ottawa, Canada
user_review: I ordered a pasta dish with salmon. The dish was overly salty and they must've forgot if they were putting cooked salmon or smoked salmon, so it had both. After about 10 minutes I was sick to my stomach. The cooked salmon did not sit well as it was undercooked. I dined with my family, they all agreed their meals could've been done better. It's unfortunate, the place had a beautiful interior and the service was pretty quick on a busy night.

Really didn't enjoy my experience here at all. We were staying nearby and it looked busy so we thought that was a good sign. the tables are very close together so there isn't much room to move. We were seated in a corner beside a group of 6 young men. They were rowdy and frankly smelt bad. One kept getting up, and every time I got his backside in my face, and one time literally on my breakfast. Nice. When this group left we got another group of college kids who seemed to have been out drinking all night. One sneezed all over my breakfast, then spent the rest of his time loudly blowing his nose staring in his used tissue groaning then blowing his nose again. His friends mostly ignored him while complaining about their parents calling them. Our companions meant I was eager to leave and not eager to eat, which was no problem as the food is nothing special- think IHOP (in this case with extra germs).
The omelettes were a generous portion. Perfect meal right before our hike up Mt Royal.

Great breakfast! A few dollars more than other places but the portions are large and very tasty.--EDITMy original review above will stand. I really liked this place. Then I went back the next morning and sat at the bar. A roach crawled out from some menus and I promptly pointed it out to a waiter who smashed it. He called the head guy in charge who picked it up with a napkin and that's it. No one cleaned the bar top where the roach was crawling. Yes this place was busy at the time, but if they don't clean up in view of where a customer saw a roach, imagine what they do back in the kitchen!
Super good service, servings are very genereous, french toast are awsome and coffee is great. Omelets are great also.
This is a breakfast place I always go to when I visit Montréal. They have very generous serving portions and friendly staff. Good for families and small groups.

Excellent waffles and very prompt service. It was very lively and busy on a Saturday morning, however pleasant. The coffee wasn't very tasty though my cup was never empty. Very good breakfast spot indeed, and I would go back tomorrow if given the choice.

Amazing!! Amazing Breakfast ! - quantity, quality, display ....Should be one of the best breakfast in town! Servers - are professional and nice Environment - centrally location / downtown ...and restaurant is clean and good. Opps! - if u r not local and don't speak french ...careful with toilet sign .... I went by mistake to Ladies bathroom ...got confused or perhaps not paying attention .  for men sign is "H / Hommes"  :P

Food was excellent and the service matched. We got a table immediately. Our server was very attentive with the coffee pot. Food came out promptly. We arrived shortly before 10AM which I would recommend. There was a line down the street shortly after we were seated. A busy resturant is always a good sign. We'll be back there tomorrow.

Great breakfast potatoes, probably oven roasted. Great optional $3 fruit bowl. And $8 for 2 eggs, meat, a few fruit slices and toast is a pretty good deal.The first two times I went here I ordered eggs over easy and both times the whites came runny. Like salmonella runny. So the third time I requested over medium and the eggs were perfect: yolk totally liquid and whites totally cooked. Yum, so I will add one more review star. Service was quick and attentive. Coffee refills were frequent. Plus it's ALL-DAY-BREAKFAST!
I tried brunch today. It was good. The service was pretty nice. But nothing too special or out of expectation.
Great food there . Love the waffle. Great amount for breakfast, ate it for lunch though. The environment there is pretty good
Coffee tasted like water. Food was tasteless too. The service was good but the quality of the food was not good so I won't go back

went here for brunch and breakfast is served until 5pm!! my friends and i had 2 pitchers of red sangria (30$) and mimosa ($42). they were both well made, not watered down at all. I had the universal breakfast which came with toast, 2 eggs, fruits, and choice of bacon vs sausage, and waffles vs french toast vs crepe - all for $16. the drink service was quite slow but they made up for thr food being fresh and delicious!

Pretty good spot. Came here for breakfast. It was packed!! Food came out quick and was tasty. Had the eggs benny. The hollandaise was amazing.Would come back again in a heartbeat. Biggest positive was the speed service. To the point and friendly.

Brilliant brunch place, conveniently located and worth every bit of it. We have been going to this place ever so often and it is one of the best brunches I have had in town. You would get spoilt by choice here, though I suggest the eggs benedict (personally think its the best on their menu). The service is great, and the waiters are extremely friendly. If you happen to go there during happy hours and want to order some appetizers, just go with the nachos (big portions and oh oh so yummy). Definitely recommend this place to everyone, and if you are getting the French toast- get the chocolate strawberry one- it has powers that can make turn any bad day into a good day.

My wife and I had our first breakfast in Montreal at this wonderful restaurant while we were on vacation. Service was impeccable. The food came out quickly and was presented beautifully. The portion sizes were overwhelming, the price is very reasonable. The food taste is extraordinarily fresh, with a delicate balance of both sweet and savory with every bite. This place is a must if you're looking for a solid breakfast choice. The only thing I was not a fan of, was my stomach's inability to devour another breakfast.

"Very average" is how I would describe my experience at Universel Déjeuner et Grillades. While the food is not exactly terrible, it is barely okay and definitely too pricey for what it is.My husband and I went visited Universel on a Tuesday evening during "Happy Hour" (4-7PM), which allows for two drinks for the price of one, a very nice touch and probably the only redeeming part of the experience, alongside the waiter's mostly genuine but strained smile. I had a veggie pizza which turned out to be as unmemorable as any other cheap pizza place (except I would probably pay less for it elsewhere - heck, even pizzapizza is tastier!). He had a vegetarian souvlaki which was first served to him with chicken, until we went to the counter to point out there had been a mistake with our order. Five minutes later, the right plate was brought from the kitchen; much better, but still very "okay" taste-wise.The sangria was good enough, and so was the house red wine, especially with the 2 for 1 promotion. The place looks nice... And that's pretty much it. Unexciting experience. I can think of many better places to spend my money at in Montreal's vibrant restaurant scene. We will not go back.

Good breakfast and a very nice room. We came here because it was so close to our hotel and every time we had walked past it had a huge line up. The benny plates were huge and everything was delicious. Prices are a bit high, but you're paying for the location and the slightly upscale surroundings. Service was OK. Friendly enough, but never refilled coffee, though other sections of the restaurant seemed to get more prompt service.

Such a chill & vibrant place for brunch. It was packed when we arrived but we barely had to wait. There's seatings inside & outside so that a plus. Service was good and quick and the food was AMAZING! Prices are decent. I highly recommend checking this place out. There's more than one locations too!
Another great place for breakfast in downtown Montreal. Very good portions and free wifi. Service also great.
Wow ! Great place to get authentic French food! Everything is fresh and delicious! We ate breakfast here back to back!

I have had brunch here a few times.  The brunch is always good...especially the home fries!  Love the strawberry mimosas!  I got the breakfast burger the last time I went and it looked and tasted delicious!!!!

TERRIBLE SERVICE. Door person messed up on names, 50min wait for a table for two. She saw us, and identified that we were there earlier, but forgot to take our name down. She then made us wait again, while everyone behind us got to go ahead.AVOID. GO ELSEWHERE.

This was a fantastic brunch on Sunday! We're in town and staying around the corner at the Omni. We were seated right away even though it was very busy. The server was super attentive and the food came fast and hot. I got the Eggs Benedict with Salmon and they were great! My husband got the Eggs Florentine he loved them. The eggs were a little on the hard side not runny but they were still tasty so If you like them more runny then just be sure to specify. The portions are big we couldn't finish our whole plate. They all came with fruit and potatoes. All in all great meal!

Had a fantastic breakfast at Universel! Came by with three friends on a Sunday morning and didn't even have to wait! I was so excited about my food I couldn't even remember to take a photo- so unlike me. I got the bacon eggs benedict (my weakness) and I've never had eggs benedict come with cheese on it and it was surprisingly lovely! They also make a GREAT hollandaise. Their breakfast potatoes were so good that they deserve their own paragraph! Seriously, they were life changing. They didn't even need ketchup! They were so crisp and so well seasoned. The food came out incredibly quickly and definitely fresh! Highly recommend!

Food is good service is ok and music is not great. Techno music while you eat is not that great.Other than that, the food was good. I had the salmon which was good. My girlfriend had the beef and it was surprisingly tender. We also had the 2 for 1 on the wine which is a great thing.

JJ and I woke up early one day in Montreal to find snow gently beginning to fall, so we stayed close to the hotel for breakfast. We walked into Universel shortly after it opened, so there was no crowding at all. We both got coffee to get us going before settling on what to order. I liked the wide variety of eggs Benedict and omelets offered on the menu and it took me a while to decide. I ended up having the smoked salmon benedict, which also came with a cup of fresh fruit and home fries. Everything was really good--the salmon wasn't too fishy, and the home fries were really well-seasoned. All in all, this was a great start to the morning--we didn't have to wait for a table, the service was fast, and we ate our fill before heading off to start the day's adventure.

A no from me. Attracts lots of tourists but definitely the worst brunch place in Montreal. The food is mediocre at best and there is an incredible amount of people that find things in their food. Last time I visited Universel, I found a piece of plastic in my pasta. This sparked a conversation with the rest of the table where one had found a hair, and a bug in previous visits. If you want to find a good brunch restaurant in the area, just walk down the street!
I went here for lunch two days in a row, and wasn't disappointed either times. Excellent food, and my food came out less than five minutes after ordering.

Mushroom and Goat Cheese Eggs Benedict was seriously amazing the first time I tried it but the next time I went back for brunch and got the same thing, nothing was great. There were small pieces of egg shells in my eggs benny and the eggs weren't runny at all. The potatoes and fruit weren't as good as the first time I went... Too many good brunch options in Mtl to return.

Great little brunch place tucked away on this busy street with indoor-outdoor seating.  We walked in on a Monday morning and were seated right away.Our waitress was darling, she was friendly, quick and helpful.I ordered the assorted fruit waffle with English cream. What a visual and taste bud delight. Absolute spectacular in every way.My husband ordered the crepe with Apple, bacon and cheddar. It was served with home fries and a side of fruit. The home fries were spot on for me. The crepe was not cult of tea but my husband loved it so it was a draw. Prices were very reasonable and we spent a lovely morning sitting on the covered patio. Highly recommend you try it for breakfast.

Came here for breakfast at 8 am on Sunday. Place quickly started to fill up and we realized we got lucky to come so early. The service was wonderful, the food was excellent, and nice music which wasn't too loud was the perfect start to our day. We shared the L'Eclipse smoothie, the egg, crepe and fruit combo, as well as the yogurt with fruit and granola. We couldn't even begin to eat the fruit with granola and yogurt as our bellies were already happily full with the rest. Absolutely loved this place and will come back again when we return to Montreal. The waffles other people ordered looked beautiful and delicious and everything everyone around us was eating smelled amazing. It's a shame we couldn't keep on eating! Keep in mind two things, dishes are huge so don't be greedy and share, also they do take credit cards but not Samsung or Apple pay. Lovely experience.

The service was LOOOOOONG! The restaurant was very busy i'll agree, but seriously over 45 minutes of a wait for breakfast is a bit too much.The breakfast was ok, service was just ok too... The other thing i found worst than the wait for our meals is the fact that they have only 2 bathroom stalls in such a huge restaurant!I wouldn't recommend it but I would give them a second chance...

A very nice restaurant. The breakfast food served here is the pinnacle Canadian brunch. The smoked salmon egg Benedict is absolutely excellent and very savory. The goat cheese omelette and the Nutella crepe are both solid choices as well. Be sure to order a nice coffee or freshly-squeezed juice as well.

Love it here! Universel breakfast was huge and everything on the plate was delicious. Also recommend egg benedict - fruit comes with it was great! Staff are very friendly too! It's a bit pricey but the experience will give you a great start of the day!

So good, we returned twice in one weekend!I'd heard about Universel from a couple of Yelpers so we planned to stop in for breakfast on our trip to Montreal. But we loved it so much the first time, we decided to stop in again 2 days later!On our first visit, we had a very late lunch after driving down from Mont Tremblant. They've got a very large menu with so many diverse choices. I opted for the Tortellini Gigi with 3 cheeses as it sounded quite hearty. It ended up being a great choice! Stuffed with 3 cheeses and soaked in a creamy tomato sauce and topped with mushrooms, every bite was oh so good!On the second visit, we stopped in for a late breakfast. I was torn between sweet and hearty as I wanted the energy of protein but sweet things like french toast and crepes were calling my name. I read up and down the crepe options and saw a few with protein. I opted for the bacon, apple, and cheddar crepes which quite honestly seemed like an odd combination. The crepes came out a tad on the thick side but it didn't matter because they were so good. The cheddar, apple, and bacon combination was delicious! I scarfed every bit down!Service was friendly on both visits and the warm atmosphere was a nice break from the cold. The decor is hip and contemporary with lots of green, mirrored surfaces, and large booths. It's a great place to host a large group with plentiful space. The great reviews bestowed upon Universel are well deserved. It was a huge hit for us.....twice! It's must do, at least once, on your Montreal visit.

Just arrived in town and wanted some comfort food late at night.  We ordered two burgers with onion rings for take out.  ....everything was delicious! all the condiments and everything we needed were thoughtfully provided with the order without even having to ask.  The 'American' burgers are on an interesting pretzel bun with cream cheese and fried onions - Delish! and accompanied by very large and tasty, crispy onion ringsDelicious Poutine, friendly barkeep!, the roast beef sandwich was delish.... really liked their gravy.

We went here for breakfast on a Saturday morning. The vibe is a bit retro with the interior design. The food was okay. Omelette wasn't very flavorful.Eggs Benedict was okay. Fruit as fresh and flavorful. Homefries were good. Latte was good as well.

Good but not the bestI went there once but I wouldn't recommend it for a visitor!! There's so many great restaurants in Montreal needed to be discovered I liked the place the decorations , l could not finish my plate cause the size of the meal are really large!! And the good thing though is that you can order half of the size !! also the service is good and fast.

I love eggs Benedict and I was not disappointed when trying it here! I went on a busy Saturday for brunch and was seated right away and received my food within 10 minutes of sitting down. It was not a long wait at all! The fruit is fresh and Daniela our server made sure we were well taken care of! Hope to return soon.

All I can say for sure about Universel is that my experiences have been inconsistent. I've had days when service and food have been great then others where both are less than average. Food is good, however presentation needs a little work in my opinion. I once ordered poached eggs and mistook them for cottage cheese. The way the food is displayed on plates is a little awkward. On numerous occasions, my waitress has disappeared except for talking my order and handing me my bill. Not too sure if I'll head back here...

Went here on a Sunday day late morning and there was a line up but we only waited about 5mins  they had things moving quickly which was great. I ordered the French toast w bananas strawberries and  Nutella...it was great! My partner ordered eggs toast home fries and beans he also loved it ..over medium and cooked to perfection ..can't complain at all.

Location: On Peel above de Maisonneuve. The closest subway is Peel (green) and street parking is available, though will be difficult to find unless you're there first thing in the a.m.The place: The space is quite big and also includes a fairly large terrace. The lighting is a bit dim but as long as I can read the menu and see what I'm eating, I'm good!The goods: So I went two days in a row because I needed major sustenance after two back to back U2 shows =-D.  Both days I ordered the veggie omelet (sans sweet potatoes or goat cheese) - this was served with home fries and coffee, and I ordered a side of sausage. The omelet was pretty darn big and these guys don't skimp on the potatoes. There were three sausages. I have nothing to say about anything - the food was great and my friends left satiated and satisfied. We definitely plan to go back. The only thing I should point out is that the coffee isn't that great.Service: Both days were great. The wait staff is attentive and our water and coffee was constantly being re-filled. Price point: I think with tip, my breakfast came out to $20. This is definitely a great place to check out when you're in the downtown core and in the mood for a great brunch.

Crepes were amazing! Large portions for brunch and delicious coffee. Service was fast and efficient but hyper masculine and waiter would only address my brother and male cousin. Good ol boys club service in Montreal

While walking from our hotel we saw many people on the patio so we decided to stop in for breakfast at 9:00am on a Tuesday. We waited at the host stand unacknowledged while servers passed us by. After a couple of minutes someone brought us to our table outside and there we waited to be acknowledged by our server for 5 minutes. At that time we were ready to order and our interaction with our server was quick. The food came out rather fast and were large portions. My husband ordered a crepe which was good and I ordered a combo plate that was a great deal as I thought it was just eggs and a waffle with blueberries but it included eggs, half a waffle, four pieces of toast, hashbrowns, and some fruit. Our server asked if our food was good on her way by and then we were done for minutes before she offered to bring us the check. At that point they had another small rush and all servers and the busser seemed to be stressed out scrambling to catch up. We began to feel their stress and wanted to leave but our server had forgotten our check and was too hard to track down. Again we waited for her to return and then return again with the POS system and it seemed to take to long for her and she mumbled goodbye as she hardly walked away. Overall food was good, not outstanding, service was terrible.
Good service. Good food. Ridiculous portions. This was an awesome breakfast spot on my way to Mont Royal. I would definitely go back! The breakfast sandwich was the pretty delicious.

Food was delicious and portion sizes enormous . We tried the breakfast poutine and loved it .. also fresh fruit smoothies are highly recommended .. just get them straight thou , barely tasted the shot of rum I added on . Paid Parking is available on the streets and customer service was great !

I will definitely be coming back! Staff was wonderful & well mannered even though the lady who seated us seemed a bit snotty. We were seated in the heated area.. but the heat was a bit much since it was blowing right on us. But it wasn't terrible. Food was great.

Amazing place, we loved it.Huge and trendy, finely furnished.The staff is perfect, friendly, smily and fast, really professional.The food is very good, I've been there twice and with my  wife we tried a lot of plates, everything is delicious and very big.Pasta is good, I'm from Italy, I know pasta, and their way to prepare pasta is good, not great, but very good.They have 2 kinds of menu, one for dinner and breakfast and another one for lunch.Both are various and with a lot of choice.Will go Back to try their breakfast.
Amazing breakfast, we had the mushroom and universel Eggs Benny and they were great. The service was even better, fantastic waitress

After an epic walk from our B&B then up and down Mount Royal we wanted something close by. I yelped for restaurants and this one sounded good. We sat at the bar and our waiter could not have been more attentive. Gave us plenty of time to look through the menu while keeping our water glasses filled. He made beer recommendations to my friend and was on top of anything we needed. Excellent service!  Then there was the food. Wonderful!  My friend ordered an appetizer of escargot in a cream sauce with some fresh rolls that was amazing. I wasn't thrilled at the idea of snails but this was terrific. The cream sauce was amazing. I had a roast beef sandwich on a baguette with coarse mustard and onion confit, lettuce and tomato. This came with a side salad, I ordered the house, with an incredibly delicious dressing. My buddy ordered a salmon tartare that was somehow mixed with avocado and subtle amounts of onion and a balsamic drizzle over the whole thing. It was served with crostini. If I was a permanent resident of Montreal I'd eat here often.

I love breakfast at breakfast and breakfast at lunch. I ate here twice in the week I was visiting Montreal and had breakfast food both times. Delicious crepes, Belgian waffles with strawberries/whipped cream/almonds, potatoes, and fresh-squeezed orange juice. The lunch items I saw look great also. Large menu with so many tempting options. We got in without a reservation on weekdays with no issues.

My weekend long Montreal trip included a lot of eating and this place was one of them.There were four of us and we went on a Sunday morning, although it looked very busy we were seated almost immediately. They did however ask us if our entire group was there (I think that makes a difference).They have a beautiful sunny sun room which was full and we couldn't get a table there, so we were shown to our booth. The indoor space is very sunny too (on a sunny day of course). The place was clean and looked upscale. The menu was very extensive and since there were four of us, we did end up trying different things. Friend No.1 had the Mexican Breakfast which I did not try but he said it was good not great. Friend No.2 had Eggs Benedict which she said was really good. Mr. H had a veggie omelette and that was yumm. He also tried L'éternité a fruit smoothie with strawberries, banana, mango, yogurt and honey, this was really good.
